references.paper_title: Efficient sleep stage recognition system based on EEG signal using k-means clustering based feature weighting
references.reason: This paper is foundational in applying k-means clustering to EEG signals for sleep stage recognition, providing a baseline for comparison with more advanced deep learning approaches.

references.paper_title: U-Time: A fully convolutional network for time series segmentation applied to sleep staging
references.reason: This paper introduced a U-Net-based architecture for sleep staging, demonstrating the effectiveness of convolutional neural networks for time-series data analysis, influencing later works which adopted similar architectural approaches.

references.paper_title: GraphSleepNet: Adaptive spatial-temporal graph convolutional networks for sleep stage classification
references.reason: This work explores the use of graph convolutional networks for sleep staging, incorporating spatial and temporal information from the EEG data, providing a novel approach to feature extraction and classification.

references.paper_title: Joint classification and prediction CNN framework for automatic sleep stage classification
references.reason: This paper proposed a CNN-based approach for sleep staging that incorporates both classification and prediction tasks, improving the model's ability to learn temporal dependencies within the sleep data.

references.paper_title: Transsleep: Transitioning-aware attention-based deep neural network for sleep staging
references.reason: This paper utilized a Transformer network to learn temporal dependencies, incorporating a novel transitioning-aware attention mechanism, advancing the use of attention-based deep learning methods for sleep staging.
